question: You are lying on your bed eating chips. Crumbs fall on your chest. What are you doing?
responses: I'll use my thumb to pick them off my chest and eat them.
I'll pick up the crumbs and throw them in the trash.
Dump the crumbs on the floor

question: You're vacuuming the carpet. One thread is not getting sucked up. You bend down, take the thread in your hand and do what?
responses: I'll take it to the trash and keep vacuuming.
Throw it on the floor and give it a second chance.
Bring it to the vacuum to suck it up.

question: You are standing in front of an open refrigerator and drop an ice cube on the floor. What do you do?
responses: I'll discreetly kick the ice under the refrigerator.
I'll pick the ice up off the floor

question: You're picking out eggs at the supermarket. You open the carton and there are beaten eggs in the carton. What do you do?
responses: I'll put this box aside and keep looking.
I'll open another box and swap the beaten eggs for whole ones.
I'll go complain to the salesman or manager.

question: You have a can of cold beer in your hand. Your friend comes running over, shows you a lump on his forehead, and asks you for the can to relieve the swelling. What are your intentions?
responses: A friend will return the jar already warm, I'll keep it and offer an alternative
My friend needs it more now, I'll give him a can of beer.

question: You habitually go to the store. You are habitually pestered by Arkasha the drunkard asking for money for a hangover, but this time he promises to sing the song “Terminator” by the band “Leningrad” for your donation. What will you do?
responses: I'll pass by, Arkasha is a low-down man who walks the road of lies and won't sing me a song.
I'll give 50 rubles, because in case of talent Arkasha has the opportunity to support a budding star.

question: You are walking down the street and notice an unfamiliar and annoying person. You don't want to greet him. What do you do?
responses: I'll punch him and move on.
I'll walk on by without making eye contact. No contact, no greeting.
I'll take out my phone and start digging around, maybe pretend I'm getting a call.

question: You are paying at a supermarket checkout. The cashier gives you your change in bills and coins and is ready to serve the next customer. What do you do?
responses: I take my change and step away from the cash register, then put the coins and bills in my wallet.
I will put the change in my purse without leaving, but I will try to do it quickly.

question: You sit down on a leather couch. It suddenly makes a squeaking sound like a fart. What do you do?
responses: I won't let it show because it can happen to anyone.
Immediately fake a fart sound so no one will suspect a fart.

question: Your friend has started hiccupping out of the blue. He is very uncomfortable and you want the hiccups to stop. What do you do?
responses: I'll try to improve the moment to scare my friend - I know it's the best way.
I'll say out loud “hiccups and hiccups go to Fedot, from Fedot to Yakov, from Yakov to everyone” - this is the traditional way of dealing with hiccups.
I'll offer to drink some water.
